description.en: Independent research on a topic given out by the instructor.
description.et: Iseseisev töö õppejõuga eelnevalt kokkulepitud teemal.

objectives.en: The student will pursue an independent research project with the aim to study literature, strengthen the understanding of theory, and acquire practical skills.
objectives.et: Üliõpilane viib läbi iseseisva uurimisprojekti eesmärgiga läbi töötada kirjandust kinnistada teooriat ja rakendada seda praktikasse.

learning_outcomes.en: The student will acquire further skills in reading software engineering research literature, practical analysis skills, and scientific writing.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane saab jätkukogemuse tarkvaratehnika valdkonnas allikmaterjalidega töötamisel, praktilisi oskusi analüüsimisel ja teaduslikul vormistamisel.

independent_work.et: Will be decicided in individual consultation with the lecturer for each project separately.

description.et:
The final grade is established based on the performance in the assigned project, written report and participation in the meetings.

Assessment criteria for the written report include:
-	Depth of analysis
-	Relevance and extent of related work
-	Quality of the report in terms of language, organization, presentation and discussion of results, logic of argumentation, coverage of threats to validity
-	Readiness to be submitted to a conference or journal (at least category B according to CORE categorization)

E - The form is, in general, in compliance with the requirements and correct; references are minimal; the elements of analysis and independent interpreting are there; the coverage of the subject is, in general, logical, but the connections have gaps; some threats to validity mentioned; paper not yet ready for submission
D - The form is in compliance with the requirements and, in general, correct; references are minimal, but relevant; the analysis and independent interpreting is understandable, but at times incomplete; the coverage of the subject is logical; threats to validity are discussed; paper not yet ready for submission
C - The form is in compliance with the requirements and correct; references are relevant and sufficient; analytical connections and interpretations are proper; the treatment of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses; threats to validity are thoroughly discussed; the paper can be submitted with moderate additional effort;
B - The form is excellent; the choice, amount and association of references with the text is very good; thorough analysis of connections and references; treatment of the subject as a whole is logical and smooth; threats to validity are thoroughly discussed; the paper can be submitted with little additional effort;
A - the form is excellent; the choice, amount and association of references with the text is creative; the depth of the analysis and the level of independent interpretation is remarkable; the treatment of the subject is innovative and logical; the text is a remarkable achievement on the whole; the paper can be submitted as-is;

If the student does not show sufficient progress or doesn't attend schedule meetings the final grade can be reduced by up to one letter grade.

grade_preconditions.et: The student must attend the scheduled meetings and demonstrate work progress; the written report must be submitted to the lecturer on time;

grade_evaluation.et: The final assessment will be based on the degree to which the assessment criteria for the written report are fulfilled.

debt_elimination.et: The written report can be submitted up to two weeks later than the set submission deadline but will result in an automatic reduction of the final grade by one letter grade.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
These tasks may include the design and execution of systematic literature studies and surveys, the design and execution of experimental studies, the development and application of research prototypes, and the writing research reports and papers. Intermediate results must be presented in individually scheduled meetings.
Participation in this course is by invitation from the course responsible only.
